detail_description: Panambur Beach, located about 10 km north of Mangalore, offers a pristine coastal stretch with sun-kissed sands and turquoise waves. This charming beach has been popular since the 1990s for its tranquil environment and joyful vibe, attracting young locals and students throughout the year. Visitors can stroll along casuarina groves facing an iconic lighthouse or relax under coconut canopies while enjoying the shimmering blue expanse of the sea merging into the cyan horizon.
name: Panambur Beach
address: 575010, India

excerpt: Completed in 1885, this grand Christian chapel features many notable frescos by an Italian artist.
detail_description: St. Aloysius Chapel, completed in 1885, is a grand Christian chapel located in Mangalore. The chapel features remarkable frescos by Italian artist Antonio Moscheni that depict the life of Aloysius Gonzaga and Jesus Christ, from birth to crucifixion. Situated atop Light House Hill, it boasts impressive architecture reminiscent of the Sistine Chapel in Rome. This historical gem is a must-see for art enthusiasts and those on a spiritual journey in Mangalore.
name: St.Aloysius Chapel
address: P B No 720, P, B 720, St Aloysius College Rd, Kodailbail, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

excerpt: Hindu temple, founded in the 10th or 11th century, with bronze statues & annual festivals.
detail_description: The Kadri Shree Manjunatha Temple, located in Mangalore, is a stunning Hindu temple with a rich history dating back to the 10th or 11th century. The temple underwent significant transformation during the 14th century, evolving into a solid stone structure. It houses an ancient idol of Lord Manjunathaswamy and features exquisite black granite sculptures and copper roof shikharas.
name: Kadri Shree Manjunatha Temple
address: Kadri Kambla Rd, Vasanth Vihar, Kadri, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575002, India

excerpt: This sizable sandy beach accessed by bridge or ferry offers a tranquil environment & lifeguards.
detail_description: Tannirbhavi Beach, accessible by bridge or ferry from the Gurupura river, is a tranquil and popular destination known for its vast shores and captivating atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy activities such as camel riding, swimming, and surfing while basking in the golden sands and azure blue waters. The beach offers a paradisiacal retreat ideal for relaxation, with stunning views during sunrise and sunset.
name: Tannirbhavi Beach
address: Kasba Bengre, 575010, India

excerpt: Scenic tourist locale offering an artisan's village, a lake, zoo, water park & botanical gardens.
detail_description: Pilikula Nisargadhama, located near Mangalore, is a picturesque tourist destination that offers a blend of natural beauty and recreational attractions. The area features an artisan's village, a lake, zoo, water park, and botanical gardens. Visitors can explore tropical forests teeming with wildlife such as Capybara families and tropical birds. Traditional cottages and vibrant flower gardens add to the charm of this nature campus.
name: Pilikula Nisargadhama
address: Pilikula Road Mudushedde, Post, Vamanjoor, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575028, India

detail_description: Kadri Park is the largest park in Mangalore and a popular attraction for locals and tourists alike. It offers various entertainment options such as musical fountain shows, laser light shows, and flower displays throughout the year. The park also boasts a diverse range of rare animals, making it an ideal spot for morning walks, picnics, and leisurely strolls. Visitors can enjoy the serene ambiance created by lush greenery, well-maintained pathways, and towering trees.
name: Kadri Park
address: VVQ4+HFX, Kadri, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575004, India

detail_description: Milagres Church, located in the Hampankatta area, is a historic Roman Catholic church in Mangalore. Built in 1680 by Bishop Thomas de Castro, it underwent reconstruction and was completed in 1784. The church is renowned for its century-old architecture, historical significance, and religious importance. Despite the original structure being demolished by Tipu Sultan, remnants like the cemetery and a Chapel still stand.
name: Milagres Church
address: Milagress Cross Rd, opposite Vishal Travels, Hampankatta, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

detail_description: Mangaladevi Temple Rd is a significant location in the coastal city of Mangalore, named after the presiding deity, Mangaladevi. The temple, built in the 9th century by King Kundavarman, showcases intricate carvings and unique architecture. Devotees from all over India visit to seek blessings for prosperity and well-being from this form of Hindu goddess Shakti. The surrounding natural beauty adds to the allure of this sacred site.
name: Mangaladevi Temple Rd
address: Mangaluru, Karnataka, India

excerpt: Vibrant 9th-century Hindu temple featuring a multi-level gateway, compound walls & numerous shrines.
detail_description: Mahatobhara Sri Mangaladevi Temple is a vibrant 9th-century Hindu temple located in Mangalore, formerly known as Mangalapur. It is dedicated to Goddess Mangaladevi, a form of the Hindu god Shakti. The temple features multi-level gateways, compound walls, and numerous shrines with Kerala-style architecture.
name: Mahatobhara Sri Mangaladevi Temple
address: Mangaladevi Temple Rd, Bolar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

detail_description: Surathkal Beach, situated along the Konkan coast, is a serene and unspoiled destination near Mangalore. Just 13 km from the bustling city of Mangalore, this beach boasts powdery sand that's perfect for leisurely strolls. The picturesque coastal landscape is enhanced by a charming lighthouse that offers stunning views of the surrounding countryside. It's considered one of the top attractions in Mangalore and provides a tranquil escape from the tourist crowds often found in nearby Goa.
name: Surathkal Beach
address: XQRV+M7R, Beach, Surathkal, Karnataka 575014, India

detail_description: Surathkal Beach, located 12 kilometers from Mangalore in Karnataka, India, is a serene and picturesque destination along the Arabian Sea. The beach features soft golden sands perfect for leisurely strolls and relaxation. Visitors can also enjoy the iconic Surathkal Lighthouse, offering panoramic views of the area. The beach has a laid-back vibe with soothing waves in the background and local joints serving delicious snacks nearby.
name: Surathkal Lighthouse Beach
address: 2Q4Q+4M3, Srinivasnagar, Surathkal, Karnataka 575025, India

excerpt: Ancient, bustling Hindu temple complex known for its numerous festivals & social & cultural events.
detail_description: Shree Sharavu Mahaganapathi Temple is an ancient Hindu temple complex in Mangalore, known for its vibrant festivals and cultural events. The interior of the chapel is adorned with a stunning series of paintings covering every inch of the roof and walls. This sacred center, with a history spanning 800 years, is part of a cluster of revered temples in the area.
name: Shree Sharavu Mahaganapathi Temple
address: Sharavu Ganapathi Temple Rd, opp. Ideal Towers, Hampankatta, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

excerpt: Deep-water industrial port, with berths, immigration facilities & a lounge for cruise ships.
detail_description: New Mangalore Port, located 4 km from the city center of Mangalore, is the ninth largest port in India. Established in 1974 at Panambur, Karnataka, it spans approximately 480 hectares and is the deepest inner harbor on the west coast. Operated by New Mangalore Port Authority, it is equipped with 16 berths and offers various facilities for cargo and cruise services.
name: New Mangalore Port Authority
address: NH 17 New, New Mangalore, Indian Oil Tank Farm, Kasba Bengre, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575010, India

excerpt: Bejai is one of the major localities in Mangalore city, Karnataka, India. The series of Bharath malls, Bharath mall & Bharath mall 2, are located here. It is one of the upscale & the busiest residential cum commercial localities of Mangalore. Wikipedia.
name: Bejai
address: Mangaluru, Karnataka, India

name: Bengre Beach
address: RRXG+4QQ, Bengre, Netravati River Area, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575013, India

excerpt: Deep-water industrial port, with berths, immigration facilities & a lounge for cruise ships.
name: New Mangalore Port Authority
address: NH 17 New, New Mangalore, Indian Oil Tank Farm, Kasba Bengre, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575010, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Mangalore, the Mangaladevi Temple Dwara stands as a testament to devotion and history. Dedicated to Goddess Mangaladevi, an incarnation of Shakti or Durga, this ancient temple dates back to 9000 AD, making it the oldest sacred site in the region. Pilgrims and devotees flock here to pay their respects and seek blessings from the revered goddess, immersing themselves in a rich tapestry of spiritual heritage.
name: Mangaladevi Temple Dwara
address: WV74+M94, Mannagudda, Konchady, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575013, India

name: Pilikula Nisarga Dhama
address: Vamanjoor, Karnataka 575028

name: Kudroli Temple Rd
address: Kodailbail, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

excerpt: Large zoo with park-like enclosures housing a variety of animals, plus botanical gardens & boating.
detail_description: Pilikula Biological Park, also known as Dr. Shivaram Karnath Biological Park, is a sprawling 370-acre park in Pilikula Nisarga Dhama that focuses on preserving the wildlife of the Western Ghats. Recognized by the Central Zoo Authority of India, this educational theme park offers a variety of features across its cultural, scientific, and educational sections. Visitors can explore large enclosures housing diverse animals and enjoy botanical gardens and boating activities.
name: Pilikula Biological Park
address: Pilikula, Moodushedde Rd, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575028, India

excerpt: Bustling beach offering swimming, surfing, life guards, toilets, concessions & parking.
name: Tannirbhavi Beach
address: VRP8+P3F, Kasba Bengre, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575010, India

name: Sri Krishna Mandira
address: VRCQ+MQ9, Hampankatta, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

detail_description: Shri Ananthapadmanabha Kudupu Temple, located in the serene village of Kudupu near Mangalore, is a revered spiritual destination dedicated to Lord Ananthapadmanabha (an incarnation of Lord Vishnu) and serpent deity worship. The temple's tranquil surroundings offer a peaceful and uplifting experience for devotees and spiritual seekers.
name: Shri Ananthapadmanabha Kudupu Temple
address: AnanthaPadmanabha Temple, Kudpu, Kulashekara, Kudupu, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575028, India

excerpt: Modest water park featuring colorful slides, a sizable swimming pool & an aquatic playground.
detail_description: Manasa Amusement Park is a delightful water park with colorful slides, a large swimming pool, and an aquatic playground. Nestled in the picturesque surroundings of Pilikula Nisarga Dhama, this park is part of a 450-acre tourism project offering various attractions like a zoo, botanical garden, heritage village, and more. Families can enjoy quality time together at this well-maintained park located just 12km from Mangalore city.
name: Manasa Water Park & Resorts
address: Pilikula Nisarga Dhama, Mudushedde, Vamanjoor, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575028, India

detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant city of Mangalore, Tannirubavi Tree Park is a delightful escape for nature lovers and couples alike. Spanning an impressive 31.5 acres, this park beautifully combines lush greenery along the Gurupura riverfront with stunning beachfront views. The diverse flora includes various species from the Western Ghats and numerous herbal plants, creating a serene environment perfect for leisurely strolls.
name: Tannirubavi TREE PARK
address: Sultan Battery, Sulthan Bathery Rd, Urva, Gandhinagar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

detail_description: Light House Hill Rd offers a stunning view of a beautiful lighthouse that overlooks the ocean and illuminates the night. The adjacent hilltop garden adds to the charm, creating a romantic atmosphere that is perfect for couples. This destination is highly recommended for young couples seeking a memorable experience.
name: Light House Hill Rd
address: Mangaluru, Karnataka, India

name: Tagore Park
address: Light House Hill Rd, Hampankatta, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

detail_description: The Infant Jesus Shrine, located at Carmel Hill in Mangalore, has been a site of worship for over 150 years. The shrine's unique architectural design is rich with symbolism derived from Biblical themes. Visitors can expect a peaceful and uplifting atmosphere, ideal for reflection and prayer. The meticulously maintained area features beautiful gardens and clean facilities, providing comfort to all who visit. Devotees praise the welcoming community and sense of peace experienced during services or prayer.
name: Infant Jesus Shrine
address: House No. # 3, Carmel Hill St. Josephs Monastery, 13-1246, Kulshekar Post, Maroli, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575005, India

excerpt: Sunset viewing is popular at these remains of an 18th-century watchtower on the water.
detail_description: Sultan Bathery, also known as Sultans Battery, is a significant historical site in Mangalore. Built by Tipu Sultan in the 18th century, this watchtower was strategically positioned to monitor naval activity. Made of black stones, it housed chambers used for storing weapons and offers stunning views of the Arabian Sea and lush surroundings from its top. Additionally, visitors can access Thannirbhavi beach from here via ferry service which operates regularly until 7pm.
name: Sulthan Battheri
address: VRQC+VCG, Sulthan Bathery Rd, Urva, Gandhinagar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

excerpt: Mangalore (or Mangaluru) is an Arabian Sea port and a major commercial center in the Indian state of Karnataka. It's home to the Kadri Manjunath Temple, known for its bronze statues, and the 9th-century Mangaladevi Temple. Its Catholic sites include Milagres Church, dating to the 17th century, and St. Aloysious Chapel, which features interior paintings. Tannirbhavi Beach is popular for its sunset views.
detail_description: Mangaluru, also known as Mangalore, is a bustling port city in Karnataka, India. The city boasts a rich cultural and religious heritage, with attractions like the Kadri Manjunath Temple and the ancient Mangaladevi Temple. Visitors can explore Catholic landmarks such as the historic Milagres Church and the ornately decorated St. Aloysious Chapel. For those seeking relaxation by the sea, Tannirbhavi Beach offers stunning sunset views.
name: Mangaluru
address: Karnataka, India

detail_description: Located in the heart of Mangalore, just 1 Km away from the railway station, Sri Venkata Ramana Temple is a sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Sri Venkata Ramana. Founded in the 17th century, this divine place emanates positive energy and spiritual vibes. The temple provides a serene atmosphere where one can feel connected to their inner self through meditation. It is believed to possess cosmic energy and offers solutions to various problems.
name: Sri Venkataramana Temple
address: VRCQ+2CF, Car Street, Hampankatta, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

excerpt: Archeological museum founded in 1865 exhibiting artifacts, such as coins, manuscripts & sculptures.
name: Srimanthi Bai Memorial Government Museum
address: VRPX+QFV, Bejai, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575004, India

name: Mangaluru International Airport
address: Bajpe Main Rd, Kenjar HC, Mangaluru, Karnataka 574142, India

excerpt: Grand, historic Hindu temple with elaborate statuary featuring deities & mythical figures.
name: Shri Venkataramana Temple, Konchady
address: WV58+QJJ, Bondel Rd, Mary Hill, Gurunagar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575008, India

name: Kodical Beach
address: New Mangalore, Baikampady, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575010, India

detail_description: Kudroli Shri Gokarnanatheshwara Kshetra, also known as the Gokarnanatheshwara Temple, is a Hindu temple located in the Kudroli area of Mangalore, Karnataka, India. Built in 1912 by Adhyaksha HoigeBazar Coragappa, this temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and was consecrated by Narayana Guru.
name: Kudroli Shri Gokarnanatheshwara Kshetra
address: VRGJ+9HG, Kudroli, Kodailbail, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

excerpt: Sacred temple situated by the Nandin River, devoted to the goddess Durga Parameshwari.
detail_description: Sri Durgaaparameshwari Temple, Kateel is a sacred and renowned temple located on an island in the Nandin River. The temple is well-maintained and accessible to physically challenged individuals with dedicated parking and clean facilities. Photography inside the temple is prohibited, but visitors can enjoy cultural programs on Friday evenings. The temple serves food twice a day, offering "Ganji Oota" in the morning and lunch in the afternoon.
name: Sri Durgaaparameshwari Temple, Kateel
address: Temple Rd, Kateelu, Karnataka 574150, India

excerpt: Unenclosed butterfly reserve set in mountain foothills, with numerous species in natural habitats.
detail_description: Sammilan Shetty's Butterfly Park is a haven for nature enthusiasts, located in the mountain foothills. Visitors can spot numerous butterfly species in their natural habitats and even take part in thrilling night walks to observe nocturnal creatures. The park also offers informative videos about the life cycle of butterflies captured by Sammilan Shetty himself. Excursions to nearby forests provide opportunities to see butterflies in their natural environment, making it a paradise for nature lovers.
name: Sammilan Shetty's Butterfly Park
address: Santhadi house NH-169 Butterfly Park Road Mangalore, Beluvai, Karnataka 574213, India

name: Kadri Park Musical Fountain
address: VVQ4+768, Kadri Temple Rd, Vasanth Vihar, Kadri, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575002, India

excerpt: Natural, sandy stretch backed by mangrove trees, known for strong waves & annual surf festivals.
name: Sasihitlu Beach
address: Sasihitlu Rd, Haleyangadi, Karnataka 575025, India

excerpt: Buddhist temple constructed in the 8th-century featuring a vibrantly adorned clay goddess statue.
detail_description: Shri Kshetra Raajarajeshwari Temple (Polali) is a renowned South Indian temple in Karnataka, featuring vibrant clay goddess statues and intricate wood and black stone carvings. The temple's architecture, with its copper-coated roof and brass-covered sides, is a sight to behold. Devotees flock to this spiritual destination seeking blessings for strength, prosperity, and protection from the powerful Goddess Rajarajeshwari.
name: Shri Rajarajeshwari Temple, Polali
address: Bantwal, Polali, Karnataka 574219, India

detail_description: I attended a marriage function and stayed near Mangala Stadium for five days. A friend recommended this place, which was conveniently close to where I was staying. With its proximity to my accommodation, I quickly acquired running shoes to make the most of this excellent facility. Mangala Stadium is particularly suitable for professional athletes, ensuring their satisfaction. The stadium opens at 4 am, allowing early morning activities such as jogging or exercise.
name: Mangala Stadium
address: Kulur Ferry Road, Mannagudda, Lalbagh, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

excerpt: Venerable cathedral, founded in 1568, with a dome inspired by St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican.
detail_description: Our Lady of Rosary Cathedral in Mangalore is a historic Roman Catholic church founded by the Portuguese in 1568. The cathedral features stunning stone architecture and a dome reminiscent of St. Peter's Basilica. Inside, visitors can admire beautiful paintings depicting events from Jesus's life. This serene sanctuary offers a peaceful escape from the bustling city life of Mangalore. Additionally, it holds historical significance as one of the three churches established by the Portuguese upon their arrival in Mangalore.
name: Our Lady of Rosary Cathedral, Mangalore
address: Hoige Bazaar, Hampankatta, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575001, India

detail_description: The Holy Cross Church in Mangalore is a captivating and enchanting place adorned with stunning and captivating paintings depicting Lady and Saint Don Bosco. The choir delivers melodious performances under the guidance of the priest, while the parish priest delivers an exceptional sermon during the Nuptial mass. This church, located in Kulashekara, is not only one of Mangalore's most beautiful churches but also holds great historical significance as one of its oldest establishments.
name: Holy Cross Church
address: Kulshekar Church Rd, Kulashekara, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575005, India

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Mangalore, the Bejai Museum stands as a hidden gem that beautifully showcases the region's rich cultural tapestry. This vibrant community museum, located within the historic grounds of the 19th-century Lady of Miracles Church, is dedicated to celebrating Christianity's deep-rooted heritage in this coastal city.
name: Aquarium & Pet Shop
address: George Fernandes Rd, opp. Bejai Church Complex, opposite ICICi bank, Bejai, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575004, India

name: Shree Vishnumurthy Temple
address: XR76+J22, Honne Katte, Kulai, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575011, India

detail_description: The Mahatma Gandhi Park is a wonderful location where people of all ages gather for their morning and evening strolls. Children can be seen enjoying the various play amenities provided, while visitors can also benefit from drinking water facilities, comfortable seating arrangements, and pleasant shade. Despite being situated in the midst of a bustling city, this park manages to create an ambiance that makes one feel far removed from urban noise and pollution.
name: Mahatma Gandhi Park
address: VRPM+Q29, Mannagudda Rd, Gandhinagar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575003, India

detail_description: Adyar Falls, nestled in the heart of Mangalore, is a charming and serene tourist attraction. While it may not be as grand as some larger waterfalls, it still holds its own unique beauty that is worth experiencing. The flowing water is refreshingly clean, making it even more enticing. To reach this hidden gem, visitors must park their vehicles at the top and embark on a 1.5-kilometer trek. One should be mindful of couples or lovers who often frequent the area.
name: Adyar Falls
address: Valachil, Adyar, Mangaluru, Karnataka 574143, India

detail_description: The Swami Vivekananda Planetarium offers an outstanding show that is worth the price of admission. The seating and 3D glasses provided are of high quality. Please take note that children under the age of three are not permitted entry, and handbags must be stored at the baggage counter. Presently, there is only one show per day at 2pm, thus it is advisable to arrive early and secure your ticket as quickly as possible during weekends and public holidays due to high demand.
name: Swami Vivekananda Planetarium
address: WVGX+PCG, Vamanjoor, Moodushedde, Karnataka 575028, India

detail_description: St. Lawrence Church in Bondel is a serene and picturesque place of worship, complete with a tranquil adoration chapel for silent prayers and a nearby graveyard for paying respects to loved ones. The spacious church grounds are ideal for various gatherings, activities, and celebrations. The devoted priests provide exceptional care to the community, making it an essential destination for mass and holy hour of adoration.
name: St. Lawrence Church, Bondel
address: WV89+VJG, Airport Rd, Bondel, Mangaluru, Karnataka 575008, India
